title: My mom is definitely my rock.
author: Alicia Keys

title: The most important thing a father can do for his children is to love their mother.
author: Theodore Hesburgh

title: Mother is the name for God in the lips and hearts of little children.
author: William Makepeace Thackeray

title: All that I am, or hope to be, I owe to my angel mother.
author: Abraham Lincoln

title: A mother's arms are made of tenderness and children sleep soundly in them.
author: Victor Hugo

title: My mother is a walking miracle.
author: Leonardo DiCaprio

title: Life began with waking up and loving my mother's face.
author: George Eliot

title: God could not be everywhere, and therefore he made mothers.
author: Rudyard Kipling

title: Sometimes the strength of motherhood is greater than natural laws.
author: Barbara Kingsolver

title: Motherhood: All love begins and ends there.
author: Robert Browning

title: Mama was my greatest teacher, a teacher of compassion, love and fearlessness. If love is sweet as a flower, then my mother is that sweet flower of love.
author: Stevie Wonder

title: Mother's love is peace. It need not be acquired, it need not be deserved.
author: Erich Fromm

title: The love of a mother is the veil of a softer light between the heart and the heavenly Father.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

title: Children are the anchors that hold a mother to life.
author: Sophocles

title: A mother's happiness is like a beacon, lighting up the future but reflected also on the past in the guise of fond memories.
author: Honore de Balzac

title: For when a child is born the mother also is born again.
author: Gilbert Parker

title: I was always at peace because of the way my mom treated me.
author: Martina Hingis

title: I remember my mother's prayers and they have always followed me. They have clung to me all my life.
author: Abraham Lincoln

title: Motherhood is... difficult and... rewarding.
author: Gloria Estefan

title: If evolution really works, how come mothers only have two hands?
author: Milton Berle

title: There is nothing in the world of art like the songs mother used to sing.
author: Billy Sunday

title: It may be possible to gild pure gold, but who can make his mother more beautiful?
author: Mahatma Gandhi

title: I got to grow up with a mother who taught me to believe in me.
author: Antonio Villaraigosa

title: With what price we pay for the glory of motherhood.
author: Isadora Duncan

title: When my mother had to get dinner for 8 she'd just make enough for 16 and only serve half.
author: Gracie Allen

title: The babe at first feeds upon the mother's bosom, but it is always on her heart.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

title: Who's a boy gonna talk to if not his mother?
author: Donald E. Westlake

title: My dear Mama, you are definitely the hen who hatched a famous duck.
author: Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec
